approval_data.project_summary: A RESTful API to manage product information, allowing users to create, read, update, and delete product entries.

requirements.title: Functional Requirement 1
requirements.description: Create Product (FR1)

requirements.title: Functional Requirement 2
requirements.description: Get All Products (FR2)

requirements.title: Functional Requirement 3
requirements.description: Get Product by ID (FR3)

requirements.title: Functional Requirement 4
requirements.description: Update Product (FR4)

requirements.title: Functional Requirement 5
requirements.description: Delete Product (FR5)

requirements.title: Non-Functional Requirement 1
requirements.description: Performance (NFR1)

requirements.title: Non-Functional Requirement 2
requirements.description: Scalability (NFR2)

requirements.title: Non-Functional Requirement 3
requirements.description: Simplicity (NFR3)

requirements.title: Non-Functional Requirement 4
requirements.description: Data Persistence (NFR4)

requirements.title: Requirement 1
requirements.description: Users must be able to add a new product to the system. A product must have a `name` (string), `description` (string, optional), `price` (float), and `stock_quantity` (integer). A unique ID should be automatically generated for each product.

requirements.title: Requirement 2
requirements.description: Users must be able to retrieve a list of all products. The list should include all product details (ID, name, description, price, stock_quantity).

requirements.title: Requirement 3
requirements.description: Users must be able to retrieve details for a specific product using its unique ID.

requirements.title: Requirement 4
requirements.description: Users must be able to modify an existing product's details (name, description, price, stock_quantity) using its ID. Partial updates (e.g., updating only the price) should be supported.

requirements.title: Requirement 5
requirements.description: Users must be able to remove a product from the system using its ID.

requirements.title: Requirement 6
requirements.description: API responses should be fast, ideally within 200ms for common operations.

requirements.title: Requirement 7
requirements.description: The system should be able to handle up to 100 concurrent requests.

requirements.title: Requirement 8
requirements.description: The chosen technology stack should prioritize ease of development and deployment for this initial version.

requirements.title: Requirement 9
requirements.description: Product data must be stored persistently.

success_criteria: API functions as described in functional requirements.
API response times meet performance requirements.
API handles the specified number of concurrent requests.

raw_analysis.project_summary: A RESTful API to manage product information, allowing users to create, read, update, and delete product entries.
project_goals: Provide functionality to create, read, update, and delete product information.
Prioritize ease of development and deployment.
raw_analysis.business_context: The API provides a basic product management system.

requirements.description: Users must be able to add a new product to the system. A product must have a `name` (string), `description` (string, optional), `price` (float), and `stock_quantity` (integer). A unique ID should be automatically generated for each product.
Users must be able to retrieve a list of all products. The list should include all product details (ID, name, description, price, stock_quantity).
Users must be able to retrieve details for a specific product using its unique ID.
Users must be able to modify an existing product's details (name, description, price, stock_quantity) using its ID. Partial updates (e.g., updating only the price) should be supported.
Users must be able to remove a product from the system using its ID.
API responses should be fast, ideally within 200ms for common operations.
The system should be able to handle up to 100 concurrent requests.
The chosen technology stack should prioritize ease of development and deployment for this initial version.
Product data must be stored persistently.

success_criteria: API functions as described in functional requirements.
API response times meet performance requirements.
API handles the specified number of concurrent requests.
assumptions: No user authentication/authorization is required for this initial version.
Error handling should be basic (e.g., return 404 for not found, 400 for bad requests).
The API will be deployed on a single server.

recommendations: Specify the technology stack to be used.

recommendations_for_completion: Add authentication/authorization requirements for future versions.
Define specific error codes and messages.
Choose a suitable technology stack (e.g., Node.js with Express, Python with Flask/Django).
